name: Kepler-283
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-283 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-283 is a star with 0.46999999999999986 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.57 times its radius. It is located 1547.06 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-283 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-283 b

Kepler-283 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.01 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-283.

The mass of Kepler-283 b is 5.90 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-283 b is 2.13 that of Earth. At 5.90 Earth masses, Kepler-283 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-283 c

Kepler-283 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.34 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 92.74 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-283.

The mass of Kepler-283 c is 4.03 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-283 c is 1.82 that of Earth. At 4.03 Earth masses, Kepler-283 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

With a semi-major axis of 0.341 astronomical units, and a mass of 4.03 Earth masses, Kepler-283 c could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-283, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
